summary: Our Q&A report examines the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers' process for expediting the review of permits affecting wetlands, streams, and aquatic resources. The Corps had made 23 agreements with public utilities, gas companies, and railroad carriers to receive money in exchange for expediting its permit process as of July 2, 2024. It issued over 3,600 permits under these agreements. Legally, the Corps must follow...
title: Army Corps of Engineers: Expedited Permitting Process Would Benefit from More Transparency
